Sat., Jan. 20: Be part of the ACLU team for the march and rally.
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Throughout 2017 we have seen the power of our democracy, and what can be accomplished when people go to the polls and exercise their right to vote. We have also seen firsthand the power of the people joining together in defense of civil liberties.

This year we march to the polls.

On Saturday, January 20 there will be marches throughout the state, and country – to build power and bring the kind of change that we seek for all persons in America. These events will build on the momentum and energy of last year's Women's March.

We are sponsoring the Women's March to the Polls in Chicago, and invite you to be part of the ACLU team for the rally and march.

Meet up with the ACLU for the Chicago
Women's March to the Polls
Saturday, January 20, 9:30 a.m.
150 North Michigan Avenue, Chicago
Meet us at the corner of Randolph and Michigan to get a sign and other marching gear!
Learn more on our website.

If you are unable to attend the Chicago event we encourage to look for events happening in your area. If you have any questions, please contact us at acluofillinois@aclu-il.org.

There is so much that can be achieved if we stay engaged, stay active, and participate in the process.

Sincerely,

Colleen K. Connell
Executive Director
ACLU of Illinois
